intro: Phacelia madrensis, commonly known as Madreño phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Phacelia madrensis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
